desc: The study of global change and human environmental impacts requires us to link concepts from biology, chemistry, and physics. Students investigate these links by exploring current theories in biogeochemistry, with an emphasis on understanding the feedback between physical and ecological processes, and the coupling of multiple element cycles. Laboratory activities focus on a practical exploration of the methods biogeochemists use, including experience with a variety of instruments. Prerequisite: Any level 200 biology, chemistry, or physics course; or permission of instructor. Offered Fall Semester, alternate years.
name: Biogeochemistry
notes: Students in Bio 350 must also register for lab Bio 350L. After registration, Bio 350 Biogeochemistry will become Bio/Env St 350 Biogeochemistry.
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Any level 200 biology, chemistry, or physics course; or permission of instructor. Offered Fall Semester, alternate years.
title: Biogeochemistry: Theory and Application
